attributes.name: mndltest
attributes.contribution: Created from the ground up as a learning experience and for use with personal projects. Supports the most important assertions, can simulate events, and handles outputting results into a beautiful HTML document. I like to use it with sinon.js.

attributes.name: Testing Tools Search
attributes.overview: a testing tool database and search engine
attributes.contribution: Epic is a large company, and each team has its own way of documenting testing tools it creates. I saw this as a problem, and I spearheaded an effort to index all of these pages, and I created a very flexible and exhaustive MediaWiki template for new wikis. I then leveraged the MediaWiki database and API to create a dynamic testing tool search engine that can filter by keyword and other tags.

attributes.name: Software Lifecycle Processes Internal Web Site
attributes.overview: documents Epic's processes in an easily-navigable format

screenshot.title: Software Lifecycle Processes Internal Web Site

attributes.contribution: I volunteered to create this web site to satisfy an ISO requirement; it was a personal requirement that it be easy on the eyes and easy to navigate. Because I wasn't to be responsible for the content, it had to be created in a maintainable way that allowed people unfamiliar with HTML to update it.

attributes.name: mndlCV
attributes.contribution: I wanted to create a personal web site, and I wanted to learn Ember.js, and you're looking at the result! As an Ember app, it could easily be reused to build similar resume pages.

attributes.name: mandlegaem
attributes.contribution: This was a personal project I started in 2014 and finished a year later: I wanted to improve my grasp on JavaScript and learn the ins and outs of Git, and thus a small strategy game was born.

attributes.name: mndlgaem2
attributes.overview: another JavaScript strategy game, built using Electron
attributes.contribution: Another personal project, and another strategy game; this one is more ambitious, and is still under development: as an Electron application, it's my first public foray into an app built on Node.js. I've learned a lot from it, and I plan to keep learning!
